name: Westfields Marriott Washington Dulles

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights during a corporate training event. Excellent check-in experience. The room itself was typical Marriott - in a good way. Meeting facilities were very good, comfortable and well presented. Two minor complaints: 1) Room service menu is limited and 2) Parking is quite a distance from the entrance.
reviews.title: Superior Service for Corporate Events

reviews.text: Clean rooms but you have to pay for the breakfast, Internet … No Microwave, No refrigerator ,parking...
reviews.title: They will charge you for the air you breathe....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice lobby,nice front desk but other hotels offer more for less
reviews.title: Enjoyable - each year

reviews.text: Each year we attend a Christmas party at the Westfields Marriott and each year it offers the same excellent service and clean, comfortable rooms. The grounds are beautiful and we would like to return sometime other than December to take advantage of the pool, walking trail, golf course, etc. The setup of the rooms is very nice - having a separate vanity, sink outside of the bathroom that allowed two people to get ready at once. There was even a magnifying mirror provided as well as a (yeah!) full powered hair dryer. The only problem was the lighting in this area and the bathroom - too dim! Reminded me of the kind of lighting you find in European places.. A complimentary coffee maker/service is provided - just don't use the $5 bottled water that is placed next to it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was excellent - from reception to breakfast buffet to the bar/restaurant and maid service. No problems at all in that respect.
reviews.title: Not what you'd expect from Marriott

reviews.text: I just returned from a trip to Chantilly where I stayed at the Westfields Marriott. What a treat! The front desk manager, Reza, helped me secure a perfect small conference room in very short notice. This location was perfect and worked out wonderfully. They aim to please- form the bellmen, to the room service, to housekeeping, to the restaurant staff. Everyone goes out of their way to ensure a great experience. This is my third stay at this hotel and each time the service is the same- excellent. The rooms are decent size and I like the way the closet is arranged- you can open it from two sides- near the bed and near the bathroom. ALso nice to have an extra sink outside the actual bath.
reviews.title: They aim to please
This place makes me sad
reviews.text: I'm at the Marriott Westfields right now on business. The exterior and lobby are nice but the rooms are utilitarian and depressing. I'm not sure, but I think they want $12 per day for wifi. I can't wait to check out in the morning.

this is an older hotel that I have stayed at many times over the years for business. Due to it's location and price, it is not a good location for those wanting to spend time visiting DC. It is about a 30-40 min drive into DC from here without traffic.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: The service is always nice and friendly, especially the bartenders in the hotel pub - Wellingtons. I have always received a great meal here, with the exception of my visit in Aug 2011. It was explained to me that they were working on a new cook and things were not coming out of the kitchen as they should. The rooms are simple and comfortable. I have always found the standard Marriott shower heads unenjoyable. The ones that are narrow and have a higher velocity water stream. It is nice to see that here at least in my room, they are moving towards the wider ones that seem to get more water on you.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Marriott!

reviews.text: For those that have earned lounge access, this hotel does not have a lounge. They supplement it with a buffet in the morning at their upstairs resturant. If you get more out of hotels that offer lounge access, then you may want to look to the Fairfax Marriott a short distance away.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great anniversary weekend here. The hotel offers a bar/resturant, fitness center, pool, hot tub, sanua, and steam room (which is in the womens locker room), and gym. We had a great time here. 12:00 check out was nice to have. We were the only people using the pool/spa. The only downfall was the bell hop was a bit snippy with us upon arrival. We got a great deal on the romm through a popular deals website. It included breakfast which was very yummy!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife in the Westfields Marriott because my employer had our meetings there. The meetings went well, and breakfast and lunch (nothing for vegatarians) was included, but everything else wasn't that good. They charge for EVERYTHING! No free wireless internet (and it was out for one day), breakfast starts at $10, they want to/insist on valet parking your car. The choices for dining are limited and expensive an the hotel, and nothing within walking distance (secluded location).
reviews.title: Standard fare for a convention hotel

reviews.text: Staff is very attentive, good food and facilities. Guest rooms are modern and hotel grounds beautiful and quiet. They could use a larger workout facility.
reviews.title: Great place for a conference

reviews.text: Hotel seems to be in the middle of nowhere - but isn't that what a conference center should be? It reminds me of the big hotels in Vegas: it takes quite awhile to get from the lobby to your room, and the parking lot is quite a hike from the front desk. On a positive note, my room was very quiet ... and housekeeping was meticulous. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was spacious. I didn't care for the battery-run alarm clock, but co-workers felt it was easy to use. Soda machine in hallway took my three dollars; I called the front desk but my do not disturb sign scared away room service (I had forgotten to remove). However, I received a reimbursement from the front desk the next morning. Breakfast and lunch staff were extremely responsive. Bar staff was okay - tap beer unavailable during happy hour on first night. Conference services were above average. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean, Big!

reviews.text: I was here for a conference. The service was top notch. My suite was great. The facilities were great. The food and food choices, on buffets, the pub and room service left a lot to be desired. There was not much choice on menus, which made it tough, there were about 4 sandwich choices in the pub, which made it no fun for a late night. I ordered room service because the menu was a little better. We had meals with the conference, they were pretty blah.
reviews.title: Great venue, beautiful rooms and crummy food

reviews.text: Probably my favorite Marriott ever. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are fantastic (large, lots of closet space), and the bar is so good - pool tables!
reviews.title: Great Marriott!

reviews.text: This place really feels like an oasis in the middle of the NOVA madhouse.
reviews.title: A resort feel...but super close to D.C.!

reviews.text: This Marriott property reminds me of something you'd find in Williamsburg....colonial style in a highly wooded area, but full of modern amenities. We stayed there two nights while visiting D.C. and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious enough for the four of us without ever feeling crowded, the beds were super-comfortable, and the outdoor pool was large and really nice! We almost forgot how close we were to a major international airport (Dulles), which you cannot hear from the hotel -- or how close we were to the City itself. Our only disappointment with the hotel was no in-room refrigerator! Even my daughter said "Mommy, can't they just buy one, they're like 60 bucks." My guess is they don't want you to have in-room food but instead want you to eat the hotel food, which would be fine if the snack shop was ever open! It was closed the entire time we where there. The mini-Starbucks in the lobby is a nice amenity, though, and fortunately Target was only a five-minute drive so we ran out for snacks and drinks and kept stuff on ice in the sink. Only other mention: ask if you will get free internet or you may end up paying $13 a day for it. Other than that -- a really nice, relaxing hotel with a resort feel. Oh, how could I forget?! The staff here is AMAZING. Just super-nice and attentive, without being smothering.
reviews.title: Nice looking hotel and decent room, but some annoyances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Marriott is an interesting one. It is a HUGE property. The rooms were nice, bed was comfortable, etc. The old colonial look of the hotel is quite nice. There were a few things that annoyed me though:
reviews.title: Great stay..............

reviews.text: - I missed the normal turn in to the hotel, so it took me a while to figure out where the front of the hotel was.
reviews.title: Very nice and peacefully located hotel

description: Located close to downtown Washington DC and the Dulles International Airport, this hotel in Chantilly, VA offers conference facilities, accommodations and activities for business and leisure travel.
